title: With the Right Nail Drill, You Can Achieve Salon-Worthy Results at Home
excerpt: For nail experts and novices looking to elevate their at-home manis, nail drills are the missing piece to your collection. Find the best nail drills here.
text: Best Nail Drill for Travel MelodySusie Portable Electric Nail DrillConsBattery doesn’t last too long Offering six drill bits and a reverse motion option, it doesn’t get better than this portable nail drill with over 53,000 glowing Amazon reviews. Customers mention this drill has a nice cord length, rests easily in the hand, and is quiet in all settings, too. Even a self-proclaimed professional nail artist calls this her favorite tool. Not only that, you just can’t beat the price.Includes: Drill, bits, sanding bands Battery: Non-rechargeable, plug-in cordAmazon rating: 4.5/5 starsAn Amazon reviewer says: “First off, I liked the price. Secondly, easy to hold and handle. Made doing nails near perfection in much less time than manual filing. Smaller bits made for great finishing around nail beds and cuticles. Great buy!”Best Nail Drill for Professional Results Nail Drill Electric Nail File MachineProsMultiple drill styles Marked as Amazon’s Choice, this nail drill set makes you feel like you’ve stepped foot into your own salon. The machine comes with a foot pedal to make the process easier and also allows you to file in two directions.Includes: Drill machine, sanding bands, bits, foot pedalBattery: Non-rechargeable, plug-in Amazon rating: 4.6/5 starsAn Amazon reviewer says: “I’m a licensed nail tech, and I love this drill so far, as I’ve only used it for a short time running it around my cuticle area. I love how it doesn’t stall with pressure even at a low or medium speed! I love that it has variable speed and has a forward and reverse! Especially for my own use to do my toes and or right hand! One more thing....I love that it fits all my bits!”Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowBest for PrecisionPure Enrichment PureNails 10-Piece Professional Manicure and Pedicure KitProsSeven interchangable drillsMaster the art of precision with the seven pieces included in this kit, which buffs everything from nail beds to calluses. The drills range in size, from bigger ones for more coverage to tinier tips that get in those hard-to-reach spaces. To ensure professional precision, the drill is also built with an LED light. Includes: Drill, bits, and carrying caseBattery: Plug-in cordWalmart rating: 4.8/5 starsA Walmart reviewer said: “I purchased this item and forgot I had it due to moving. I was also intimidated to try it, which led to further hesitation. I finally got it out, tried it, and I cannot believe I haven’t been using it! This made my home manicure and pedicure sessions a complete professional-like process!”Best for All Skin LevelsYblntek Electric Nail Drill MachineConsMay need something gentler for natural nailsYou won’t have to worry about the sanding bands slipping off, as this kit comes with different-size bands for specific drill bits. The rechargeable battery allows for up to four hours of work time, and the drill has five speed settings. Includes: Drill, bits, sanding bands Battery: Rechargeable Amazon rating: 4.9/5 stars An Amazon reviewer said: “You need this nail drill if you do dip powder or gel. It has cut my filing and buffing time in half, if not more! Excellent product. It charged really fast, and it holds a charge long enough to complete all ten nails at home. It comes with a huge variety of files and grits so I had all that I needed to remove old dip powder, and it had a softer grit to buff out the new. Seems easy to use, but I’m a first-time drill user and needed to read the manual to know learn how.”Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowBest Overall Nail Drill Beurer Rechargeable Manicure/Pedicure Device With a slew of drill styles and lengths to choose from, this cordless device will properly buff, smooth, and clean your nails. Increase or decrease the speed with the slide of a button to clean artificial or natural nails carefully. Additionally, it has an LED light for better visibility.Includes: Drill, bits, and carrying caseBattery: RechargeableBest Buy rating: 4.8/5 starsA Best Buy reviewer says: “It is good quality and effective. Don’t need to go to the salon anymore!”Best Nail Drill for Gel Extensions Kiara Sky Beyond Pro Portable Drill (Light Blue)ProsLED screen shows battery percentageNothing hurts worse than your nail tech’s nail drill losing its battery life in the midst of a session. Good thing Kiara Sky’s nail drill offers up to 10 hours of battery, plus an LED screen that helps you track its juice in big, bold numbers to skip the embarrassment. Even better, it’s portable and rechargeable for nail techs taking their business on the go. Includes: Drill, bits, and table standBattery: RechargeableAmazon rating: 4.2/5 stars An Amazon reviewer said: “Absolutely love this drill!!!! It comes with the best drill bit I have used by far. Makes it so much easier when filing and don’t have to change bits to finish my nails.”Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowBest Nail Drill for BeginnersFlawless by Finishing Touch Flawless Salon NailsProsCompact for easy grip ConsBattery doesn’t last too long Don’t let the compact design fool you—this drill packs a powerful punch. Practice your skills with a user-friendly kit that doesn’t break the bank and is strong enough to remove acrylic or gel. Six drill heads are included for filing, shaping, buffing, smoothing, and pushing back cuticles. Includes: Drill, bitsBattery: RechargeableUlta rating: 4.5/5 starsAn Ulta reviewer says: “I started doing my nails at home during lockdown, and when I picked up this tool, it made everything so much easier! I use it to take off my gel mani and prep and buff before I do anything else. It’s honestly fantastic and well-priced, in my opinion. Highly recommend for any beginner looking to start doing their nails at home.”Best Handheld Nail Drill Design Imene Professional Nail Drill Machine PortableProsBelt clip for movementWhether you’re using it for your natural nails, gel, or acrylic, this battery-operated drill comes with six tips that are both gentle and effective.Includes: Drill, sanding bands, bitsBattery: RechargeableAmazon rating: 4.5/5 starsAn Amazon reviewer says: “The drill handpiece is slim yet ergonomically comfortable for those who may have dexterity or arthritic problems. It’s compact and portable and perfect for the DIY nail enthusiast or technician. The drill control box is slim, lightweight, cordless, and rechargeable. And, it’s equipped with a belt clip to allow for freedom of movement.”Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowBest for Gentle Smoothing Clio Nail Grooming SetsThis sweet, sleek tool is a one-stop-shop with five interchangeable pieces for precision shaping, cuticle pushing, buffing, and smoothing.Includes: Drill, bits Battery: Two AAA batteries Target rating: 4/5 starsA Target reviewers says: “I can use the gentle shaping tool to file my cuticles more safely than trimming with a clipper. I used it on my older parent’s toenails that have thickened, and it helped a lot!”Best Nail Drill for SpeedMedicool Pro Power 520 Electric Filing SystemConsDoesn’t last too long An investment worth every penny, this powerful nail drill is beloved by professionals and amateurs alike. It’s built to work fast and also includes a reverse option. Includes: Drill Battery: Non-rechargeable, plug-in cord Sally Beauty rating: 4.1/5 starsA Sally Beauty reviewer says: “I love the fast speed of this drill, and I have never had any issues using it. I’ve had my drill for well over two years and love it. It’s very lightweight and has many drill bits that you can buy to turn your drill into whatever you want your nails to look like.”Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowBest Nail Drill for Natural NailsTouch Beauty Nail File Electric 5-in-1 Manicure Pedicure SetConsDoesn't have a long lifespan Labeled Amazon’s Choice, this portable, cordless set has it all. This nail drill offers five tip attachments and even a built-in UV light to set your polish. Includes: Drill, bits, holderBattery: RechargeableAmazon rating: 4.1/5 starsAn Amazon reviewer says: “This product is easy to use and comes with several different heads for shaping.”Best Nail Drill for All Nail Types Az Gogo Portable Nail Drill MachineThis professional-grade drill hits all the right marks, thanks to its portable design, assortment of attachments, and buffing tips. It’s also designed to offer up to eight hours of battery life on a single charge.Includes: Drill, sanding bands, bits Battery: Rechargeable Amazon rating: 4.5/5 starsAn Amazon reviewer says: “Easy to read instructions. Easy to charge, change bits, and use. Fits well in my hands. Not too heavy. The bits that come with it work well and are of good quality.”Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowWhat are best practices?Safety is important when using a nail drill, especially since improper use can cause damage and weaken your nail bed, making it difficult to cure gel polishes. “Misusing a nail drill can cause serious damage to your nails, skin, and cuticles. Investing in a good quality tool with adjustable speed settings is key! You should always use lower speeds for natural nails, only using higher speeds when working with gels or acrylics. When applying pressure, use a light touch when working with natural nails, and let the tool do the work. Don’t use the nail drill in one spot for too long, as you need to keep the drill constantly moving to prevent over-filing and building up the heat (which can cause that burning sensation, discomfort, and damage). I always advise working in short, controlled strokes rather than long sweeps for precision and safety,” April Arabella says. Meet The ExpertAdvertisement - Continue Reading BelowWhy Trust ELLE BeautyAs a leading publisher of fashion, lifestyle, and beauty content, ELLE.com is committed to highlighting the best products in various categories by personally testing the latest and most innovative products, interviewing countless experts, and vetting customer-loved items. For this piece, ELLE editors and contributors pored over reviews to find the best nail drills that are safe enough for at-home use and interview a licensed nail artist for best practices. Shop More ELLE Beauty Essentials Nerisha Penrose is the Beauty Commerce Editor at ELLE.com. Prior to joining the team, she was an Editorial Fellow at ELLE.com. In her current role, she helps lead coverage on makeup, skin care, hair, and fragrances. With over six years of experience in the world of beauty editorial, Nerisha enjoys delving deep into the complexities of fragrance notes, hunting for the best fixes for acne-prone skin, and advocating for daily sunscreen use. She regularly researches and tests the latest products, consults beauty professionals (including our Beauty Advisory Board) to determine the best expert-approved formulas to recommend, and conducts interviews with luminaries across the industry. Nerisha received her bachelor’s degree in Communication and Media Studies from Temple University before joining the editorial teams at Nylon and Billboard. In 2020, she co-launched our popular franchise The State of Black Beauty, an ongoing exploration of—and destination for—beauty at the intersection of Black culture. Sam Peters is a Senior Commerce Editor at Hearst covering fashion, beauty and lifestyle. Her writing has appeared in WWD, Footwear News, Real Simple, PopSugar and Bridal Guide, among others. She enjoys unpacking the latest trends and testing and reviewing some of the most innovative, emerging products on the market.
html:
Best Nail Drill for Travel

MelodySusie Portable Electric Nail Drill

Cons
  • Battery doesn’t last too long

Offering six drill bits and a reverse motion option, it doesn’t get better than this portable nail drill with over 53,000 glowing Amazon reviews. Customers mention this drill has a nice cord length, rests easily in the hand, and is quiet in all settings, too. Even a self-proclaimed professional nail artist calls this her favorite tool. Not only that, you just can’t beat the price.

Includes: Drill, bits, sanding bands

Battery: Non-rechargeable, plug-in cord

Amazon rating: 4.5/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “First off, I liked the price. Secondly, easy to hold and handle. Made doing nails near perfection in much less time than manual filing. Smaller bits made for great finishing around nail beds and cuticles. Great buy!”

Best Nail Drill for Professional Results

Nail Drill Electric Nail File Machine

Pros
  • Multiple drill styles

Marked as Amazon’s Choice, this nail drill set makes you feel like you’ve stepped foot into your own salon. The machine comes with a foot pedal to make the process easier and also allows you to file in two directions.

Includes: Drill machine, sanding bands, bits, foot pedal

Battery: Non-rechargeable, plug-in

Amazon rating: 4.6/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “I’m a licensed nail tech, and I love this drill so far, as I’ve only used it for a short time running it around my cuticle area. I love how it doesn’t stall with pressure even at a low or medium speed! I love that it has variable speed and has a forward and reverse! Especially for my own use to do my toes and or right hand! One more thing....I love that it fits all my bits!”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best for Precision

Pure Enrichment PureNails 10-Piece Professional Manicure and Pedicure Kit

Pros
  • Seven interchangable drills

Master the art of precision with the seven pieces included in this kit, which buffs everything from nail beds to calluses. The drills range in size, from bigger ones for more coverage to tinier tips that get in those hard-to-reach spaces. To ensure professional precision, the drill is also built with an LED light.

Includes: Drill, bits, and carrying case

Battery: Plug-in cord

Walmart rating: 4.8/5 stars

A Walmart reviewer said: “I purchased this item and forgot I had it due to moving. I was also intimidated to try it, which led to further hesitation. I finally got it out, tried it, and I cannot believe I haven’t been using it! This made my home manicure and pedicure sessions a complete professional-like process!”

Best for All Skin Levels

Yblntek Electric Nail Drill Machine

Cons
  • May need something gentler for natural nails

You won’t have to worry about the sanding bands slipping off, as this kit comes with different-size bands for specific drill bits. The rechargeable battery allows for up to four hours of work time, and the drill has five speed settings.

Includes: Drill, bits, sanding bands

Battery: Rechargeable

Amazon rating: 4.9/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer said: “You need this nail drill if you do dip powder or gel. It has cut my filing and buffing time in half, if not more! Excellent product. It charged really fast, and it holds a charge long enough to complete all ten nails at home. It comes with a huge variety of files and grits so I had all that I needed to remove old dip powder, and it had a softer grit to buff out the new. Seems easy to use, but I’m a first-time drill user and needed to read the manual to know learn how.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best Overall Nail Drill

Beurer Rechargeable Manicure/Pedicure Device

With a slew of drill styles and lengths to choose from, this cordless device will properly buff, smooth, and clean your nails. Increase or decrease the speed with the slide of a button to clean artificial or natural nails carefully. Additionally, it has an LED light for better visibility.

Includes: Drill, bits, and carrying case

Battery: Rechargeable

Best Buy rating: 4.8/5 stars

A Best Buy reviewer says: “It is good quality and effective. Don’t need to go to the salon anymore!”

Best Nail Drill for Gel Extensions

Kiara Sky Beyond Pro Portable Drill (Light Blue)

Pros
  • LED screen shows battery percentage

Nothing hurts worse than your nail tech’s nail drill losing its battery life in the midst of a session. Good thing Kiara Sky’s nail drill offers up to 10 hours of battery, plus an LED screen that helps you track its juice in big, bold numbers to skip the embarrassment. Even better, it’s portable and rechargeable for nail techs taking their business on the go.

Includes: Drill, bits, and table stand

Battery: Rechargeable

Amazon rating: 4.2/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer said: “Absolutely love this drill!!!! It comes with the best drill bit I have used by far. Makes it so much easier when filing and don’t have to change bits to finish my nails.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best Nail Drill for Beginners

Flawless by Finishing Touch Flawless Salon Nails

Pros
  • Compact for easy grip
Cons
  • Battery doesn’t last too long

Don’t let the compact design fool you—this drill packs a powerful punch. Practice your skills with a user-friendly kit that doesn’t break the bank and is strong enough to remove acrylic or gel. Six drill heads are included for filing, shaping, buffing, smoothing, and pushing back cuticles.

Includes: Drill, bits

Battery: Rechargeable

Ulta rating: 4.5/5 stars

An Ulta reviewer says: “I started doing my nails at home during lockdown, and when I picked up this tool, it made everything so much easier! I use it to take off my gel mani and prep and buff before I do anything else. It’s honestly fantastic and well-priced, in my opinion. Highly recommend for any beginner looking to start doing their nails at home.”

Best Handheld Nail Drill Design

Imene Professional Nail Drill Machine Portable

Pros
  • Belt clip for movement

Whether you’re using it for your natural nails, gel, or acrylic, this battery-operated drill comes with six tips that are both gentle and effective.

Includes: Drill, sanding bands, bits

Battery: Rechargeable

Amazon rating: 4.5/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “The drill handpiece is slim yet ergonomically comfortable for those who may have dexterity or arthritic problems. It’s compact and portable and perfect for the DIY nail enthusiast or technician. The drill control box is slim, lightweight, cordless, and rechargeable. And, it’s equipped with a belt clip to allow for freedom of movement.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best for Gentle Smoothing

Clio Nail Grooming Sets

This sweet, sleek tool is a one-stop-shop with five interchangeable pieces for precision shaping, cuticle pushing, buffing, and smoothing.

Includes: Drill, bits

Battery: Two AAA batteries

Target rating: 4/5 stars

A Target reviewers says: “I can use the gentle shaping tool to file my cuticles more safely than trimming with a clipper. I used it on my older parent’s toenails that have thickened, and it helped a lot!”

Best Nail Drill for Speed

Medicool Pro Power 520 Electric Filing System

Cons
  • Doesn’t last too long

An investment worth every penny, this powerful nail drill is beloved by professionals and amateurs alike. It’s built to work fast and also includes a reverse option.

Includes: Drill

Battery: Non-rechargeable, plug-in cord

Sally Beauty rating: 4.1/5 stars

A Sally Beauty reviewer says: “I love the fast speed of this drill, and I have never had any issues using it. I’ve had my drill for well over two years and love it. It’s very lightweight and has many drill bits that you can buy to turn your drill into whatever you want your nails to look like.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best Nail Drill for Natural Nails

Touch Beauty Nail File Electric 5-in-1 Manicure Pedicure Set

Cons
  • Doesn't have a long lifespan

Labeled Amazon’s Choice, this portable, cordless set has it all. This nail drill offers five tip attachments and even a built-in UV light to set your polish.

Includes: Drill, bits, holder

Battery: Rechargeable

Amazon rating: 4.1/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “This product is easy to use and comes with several different heads for shaping.”

Best Nail Drill for All Nail Types

Az Gogo Portable Nail Drill Machine

This professional-grade drill hits all the right marks, thanks to its portable design, assortment of attachments, and buffing tips. It’s also designed to offer up to eight hours of battery life on a single charge.

Includes: Drill, sanding bands, bits

Battery: Rechargeable

Amazon rating: 4.5/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “Easy to read instructions. Easy to charge, change bits, and use. Fits well in my hands. Not too heavy. The bits that come with it work well and are of good quality.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

What are best practices?

Safety is important when using a nail drill, especially since improper use can cause damage and weaken your nail bed, making it difficult to cure gel polishes. “Misusing a nail drill can cause serious damage to your nails, skin, and cuticles. Investing in a good quality tool with adjustable speed settings is key! You should always use lower speeds for natural nails, only using higher speeds when working with gels or acrylics. When applying pressure, use a light touch when working with natural nails, and let the tool do the work. Don’t use the nail drill in one spot for too long, as you need to keep the drill constantly moving to prevent over-filing and building up the heat (which can cause that burning sensation, discomfort, and damage). I always advise working in short, controlled strokes rather than long sweeps for precision and safety,” April Arabella says.

Meet The Expert

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Why Trust ELLE Beauty

As a leading publisher of fashion, lifestyle, and beauty content, ELLE.com is committed to highlighting the best products in various categories by personally testing the latest and most innovative products, interviewing countless experts, and vetting customer-loved items. For this piece, ELLE editors and contributors pored over reviews to find the best nail drills that are safe enough for at-home use and interview a licensed nail artist for best practices.

Shop More ELLE Beauty Essentials

Nerisha Penrose is the Beauty Commerce Editor at ELLE.com. Prior to joining the team, she was an Editorial Fellow at ELLE.com. In her current role, she helps lead coverage on makeup, skin care, hair, and fragrances. With over six years of experience in the world of beauty editorial, Nerisha enjoys delving deep into the complexities of fragrance notes, hunting for the best fixes for acne-prone skin, and advocating for daily sunscreen use. She regularly researches and tests the latest products, consults beauty professionals (including our Beauty Advisory Board) to determine the best expert-approved formulas to recommend, and conducts interviews with luminaries across the industry. Nerisha received her bachelor’s degree in Communication and Media Studies from Temple University before joining the editorial teams at Nylon and Billboard. In 2020, she co-launched our popular franchise The State of Black Beauty, an ongoing exploration of—and destination for—beauty at the intersection of Black culture. 

Sam Peters is a Senior Commerce Editor at Hearst covering fashion, beauty and lifestyle. Her writing has appeared in WWD, Footwear News, Real Simple, PopSugar and Bridal Guide, among others. She enjoys unpacking the latest trends and testing and reviewing some of the most innovative, emerging products on the market.
